TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit KeyManagerFactory extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: This class acts as a factory for key managers based on a source of key material.

remarks.para: This class acts as a factory for key managers based on a source of key material. Each key manager manages a specific type of key material for use by secure sockets. The key material is based on a KeyStore and/or provider specific sources.

Android provides the following KeyManagerFactory algorithms:
Algorithm Supported API Levels
PKIX 1+
Added in 1.4.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Obtains the default KeyManagerFactory algorithm name.
Docs.value: the default algorithm name as specified by the ssl.KeyManagerFactory.algorithm security property, or an implementation-specific default if no such property exists.

remarks.para: Obtains the default KeyManagerFactory algorithm name.
The default algorithm can be changed at runtime by setting the value of the ssl.KeyManagerFactory.algorithm security property to the desired algorithm name.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Function GetInstance (algorithm As String) As KeyManagerFactory
public: static Javax::Net::Ssl::KeyManagerFactory ^ GetInstance(System::String ^ algorithm);
public static Javax.Net.Ssl.KeyManagerFactory? GetInstance (string? algorithm);
.method public static hidebysig class Javax.Net.Ssl.KeyManagerFactory GetInstance(string algorithm) cil managed
static member GetInstance : string -> Javax.Net.Ssl.KeyManagerFactory

Docs.param: the standard name of the requested algorithm. See the Java Secure Socket Extension Reference Guide for information about standard algorithm names.
Docs.summary: Returns a KeyManagerFactory object that acts as a factory for key managers.

remarks.para: Returns a KeyManagerFactory object that acts as a factory for key managers.

This method traverses the list of registered security Providers, starting with the most preferred Provider. A new KeyManagerFactory object encapsulating the KeyManagerFactorySpi implementation from the first Provider that supports the specified algorithm is returned.
Note that the list of registered providers may be retrieved via the Security#getProviders() Security.getProviders() method.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if no installed provider can provide the requested algorithm.
if algorithm is null (instead of NoSuchAlgorithmException as in 1.4 release)

Docs.param: the standard name of the requested algorithm. See the Java Secure Socket Extension Reference Guide for information about standard algorithm names.
Docs.summary: Returns a KeyManagerFactory object that acts as a factory for key managers.

remarks.para: Returns a KeyManagerFactory object that acts as a factory for key managers.

A new KeyManagerFactory object encapsulating the KeyManagerFactorySpi implementation from the specified Provider object is returned. Note that the specified Provider object does not have to be registered in the provider list.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the specified provider cannot provide the requested algorithm.
if algorithm is null (instead of NoSuchAlgorithmException as in 1.4 release)

static member GetInstance : string * string -> Javax.Net.Ssl.KeyManagerFactory

Docs.param: the standard name of the requested algorithm. See the Java Secure Socket Extension Reference Guide for information about standard algorithm names.
Docs.summary: Returns a KeyManagerFactory object that acts as a factory for key managers.

remarks.para: Returns a KeyManagerFactory object that acts as a factory for key managers.
A new KeyManagerFactory object encapsulating the KeyManagerFactorySpi implementation from the specified provider is returned. The specified provider must be registered in the security provider list.
Note that the list of registered providers may be retrieved via the Security#getProviders() Security.getProviders() method.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the specified provider cannot provide the requested algorithm.
if the specified provider does not exist.
if algorithm is null (instead of NoSuchAlgorithmException as in 1.4 release)

MemberSignature.Value: Public Sub Init (spec As IManagerFactoryParameters)
public: void Init(Javax::Net::Ssl::IManagerFactoryParameters ^ spec);
public void Init (Javax.Net.Ssl.IManagerFactoryParameters? spec);
.method public hidebysig instance void Init(class Javax.Net.Ssl.IManagerFactoryParameters spec) cil managed
member this.Init : Javax.Net.Ssl.IManagerFactoryParameters -> unit

Docs.param: an implementation of a provider-specific parameter specification
Docs.summary: Initializes this factory with a source of provider-specific key material.

remarks.para: Initializes this factory with a source of provider-specific key material.

In some cases, initialization parameters other than a keystore and password may be needed by a provider. Users of that particular provider are expected to pass an implementation of the appropriate ManagerFactoryParameters as defined by the provider. The provider can then call the specified methods in the ManagerFactoryParameters implementation to obtain the needed information.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Sub Init (ks As KeyStore, password As Char())
public: void Init(Java::Security::KeyStore ^ ks, cli::array <char> ^ password);
public void Init (Java.Security.KeyStore? ks, char[]? password);
.method public hidebysig instance void Init(class Java.Security.KeyStore ks, char[] password) cil managed
member this.Init : Java.Security.KeyStore * char[] -> unit

Docs.param: the password for recovering keys in the KeyStore
Docs.summary: Initializes this factory with a source of key material.

remarks.para: Initializes this factory with a source of key material.
The provider typically uses a KeyStore for obtaining key material for use during secure socket negotiations. The KeyStore is generally password-protected.
For more flexible initialization, please see #init(ManagerFactoryParameters).
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if initializing this key manager factory fails.
if a required algorithm is not available.
if a key cannot be recovered.
